title: Force fresh production redeploy and verify live build marker

requirements.summary: Update the redeploy marker timestamp and buildId version to force a fresh production redeploy and change the frontend bundle hash.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/redeployMarker.ts` contains a new ISO-8601 timestamp value for `REDEPLOY_MARKER.timestamp`.
`frontend/src/redeployMarker.ts` contains an incremented `buildId` version (v10 -> v11) while preserving the existing `production-publish-v{N}-YYYYMMDD` style.
The change causes the frontend bundle hash to change (marker is imported by `frontend/src/App.tsx`).

file_operations.description: Set `REDEPLOY_MARKER.timestamp` to the current ISO-8601 timestamp at implementation time, and increment `REDEPLOY_MARKER.buildId` from `production-publish-v10-20260215` to `production-publish-v11-20260215` (preserving the `production-publish-v{N}-YYYYMMDD` pattern).

requirements.summary: Ensure the production build emits a clearly visible console log line that matches the updated redeploy marker values for post-deploy verification.
acceptanceCriteria: After deployment completes, opening the deployed site and viewing the browser console shows a line in the format `[ElectroBeez Build] ID: ${REDEPLOY_MARKER.buildId} | Timestamp: ${REDEPLOY_MARKER.timestamp}`.
The logged `buildId` and `timestamp` values exactly match the updated values in `frontend/src/redeployMarker.ts`.

file_operations.description: Adjust the build marker console log to use a non-debug level (e.g., `console.info`) while preserving the exact message format `[ElectroBeez Build] ID: ${REDEPLOY_MARKER.buildId} | Timestamp: ${REDEPLOY_MARKER.timestamp}` so it is reliably visible during production verification.

Update the verification instructions (without adding new product features) to explicitly reference checking the browser console for the exact `[ElectroBeez Build] ID: ... | Timestamp: ...` line and matching it to `frontend/src/redeployMarker.ts` after publishing the latest production build.
